laboratory_examinations.findings: White-cell count: 3300 per cubic millimeter; Hematocrit: 0.36; Platelet count: 94,000 per cubic millimeter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Subsequent CBC showed white-cell count of 2400 per cubic millimeter; Hematocrit decreased to 0.25; Platelet count decreased to 63,000 per cubic millimeter.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Serum aspartate aminotransferase level: 87 U per liter; Serum alkaline phosphatase level: 337 U per liter; Serum calcium level: 7.5 mg per deciliter.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Later liver function test showed increased serum aspartate aminotransferase level of 191 U per liter; alkaline phosphatase level remained at 337 U per liter; total bilirubin level was 13.5 mg per deciliter.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 6 to 10 white cells and an occasional red cell per high-power field.
Complement-fixation studies revealed a histoplasma titer of 1:8 (considered negative). Other tests for fungal and bacterial infections were negative.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Blood cultures at the first hospital ultimately became positive for Histoplasma capsulatum.

laboratory_examinations.findings: High serum angiotensin-converting enzyme level: 125 IU per liter.
Elevated erythrocyte sedimentation rate: 66 mm per hour.
